name: Ensure Managed IAM Policies are used instead of Inline Policies
body:
Inline policies are policies that are embedded directly into a single user, group, or role.

It is recommended to use managed policies instead of inline policies because they provide reusability, central change management, versioning and more capabilities.
remediationDescription: Consult the [AWS Documentation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/access_policies_managed-vs-inline.html) to better understand the differences between managed and inline policies. If you find out that a managed policy is better suited, follow the steps from the [AWS Documentation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/access_policies_create.html) for creating policies.
